text: The 1974 UEFA Cup Final was played on 21 May 1974 and 29 May 1974. It was between Tottenham Hotspur of England and Feyenoord Rotterdam of the Netherlands. Feyenoord won 4–2 on aggregate. ==Riot== Tottenham supporters rioted during the second leg in Rotterdam. This started after Feyenoord scored towards the end of the first half and continued into the second half. ==Route to the final== Tottenham Hotspur Tottenham Hotspur Tottenham Hotspur Tottenham Hotspur Round Feyenoord Feyenoord Feyenoord Feyenoord Opponent Agg. 1st leg 2nd leg Opponent Agg. 1st leg 2nd leg Grasshoppers 9–2 5–1 (A) 4–1 (H) First round Öster 5–2 3–1 (A) 2–1 (H) Aberdeen 5–2 1–1 (A) 4–1 (H) Second round Gwardia Warsaw 3–2 3–1 (H) 0–1 (A) Dinamo Tbilisi 6–2 1–1 (A) 5–1 (H) Third round Standard Liège 3–3 (a) 1–3 (A) 2–0 (H) 1\. FC Köln 5–1 2–1 (A) 3–0 (H) Quarter-finals Ruch Chorzów 4–2 (a.e.t.) 1–1 (A) 3–1 (a.e.t.) (H) Lokomotive Leipzig 4–1 2–1 (A) 2–0 (H) Semi-finals VfB Stuttgart 4–3 2–1 (H) 2–2 (A) ==Match details== ===First leg=== {| style="font-size: 90%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" GK 1 Pat Jennings RB 2 Ray Evans CB 3 Terry Naylor CB 4 John Pratt LB 5 Mike England RM 6 Phil Beal CM 7 Chris McGrath CM 8 Steve Perryman LM 9 Martin Peters (c) CF 10 Martin Chivers CF 11 Ralph Coates Substitutes: Substitutes: Substitutes: DF 12 Mike Dillon Manager: Manager: Manager: Bill Nicholson Bill Nicholson Bill Nicholson Bill Nicholson ===Second leg=== After holding Spurs to a 2–2 draw at London's White Hart Lane, Feyenoord went into their home leg as favourites. Their 2–0 victory at home secured the club their first UEFA Cup title. The second leg in Rotterdam was marred by violence and hooliganism from rioting Spurs supporters. {| style="font-size:90%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" GK 1 Eddy Treijtel RB 2 Wim Rijsbergen CB 3 Joop van Daele CB 4 Rinus Israël (c) LB 5 Harry Vos CM 6 Mladen Ramljak CM 7 Wim Jansen CM 8 Theo de Jong RW 9 Peter Ressel CF 10 Lex Schoenmaker LW 11 Jørgen Kristensen Substitutes: Substitutes: Substitutes: MF 12 Johan Boskamp FW 14 Henk Wery Manager: Manager: Manager: Wiel Coerver Wiel Coerver Wiel Coerver Wiel Coerver ==References== ==Other websites== *RSSSF Uefa Cup Final Category:Rotterdam
